ovotestis.definition: hermaphroditic gonad that contains both testicular and ovarian tissue

ovoviviparous.definition: producing living young from eggs that hatch within the body

ovular.definition:
1) being or of the nature of an ovule
2) of or relating to an ovum

examples.en: women ovulate about once every month

ovulation.definition: the expulsion of an ovum from the ovary (usually midway in the menstrual cycle)

ovule.definition:
1) a small body that contains the female germ cell of a plant; develops into a seed after fertilization
2) a small or immature ovum

ovum.definition: the female reproductive cell; the female gamete

owe.definition:
1) be obliged to pay or repay
2) be indebted to, in an abstract or intellectual sense
3) be in debt

examples.en: This new theory owes much to Einstein's Relativity Theory
I still owe for the car

owen.definition:
1) Welsh industrialist and social reformer who founded cooperative communities (1771-1858)
2) English comparative anatomist and paleontologist who was an opponent of Darwinism (1804-1892)

owens.definition: United States athlete and Black American whose success in the 1936 Olympic Games in Berlin outraged Hitler (1913-1980)

owensboro.definition: a town in northwestern Kentucky on the Ohio River; a tobacco market

owl.definition: nocturnal bird of prey with hawk-like beak and claws and large head with front-facing eyes

owlish.definition: resembling an owl; solemn and wise in appearance

examples.en: the gentle-looking barrister peered owlishly around him

own.definition: belonging to or on behalf of a specified person (especially yourself); preceded by a possessive

owned.definition: having an owner; often used in combination

owner.definition:
1) (law) someone who owns (is legal possessor of) a business
2) a person who owns something

examples.en: he is the owner of a chain of restaurants
they are searching for the owner of the car
who is the owner of that friendly smile?

ownership.definition:
1) the relation of an owner to the thing possessed; possession with the right to transfer possession to others
3) the state or fact of being an owner

ox.definition:
1) an adult castrated bull of the genus Bos; especially Bos taurus
2) any of various wild bovines especially of the genera Bos or closely related Bibos

oxacillin.definition: a form of penicillin resistant to penicillinase and effective against penicillin-resistant staphylococci

oxalacetate.definition: a salt or ester of oxalacetic acid

oxalate.definition: a salt or ester of oxalic acid

oxalidaceae.definition: a family of widely distributed herbs of the order Geraniales; have compound leaves and pentamerous flowers

oxalis.definition: any plant or flower of the genus Oxalis

oxazepam.definition: a tranquilizing drug (trade name Serax) used to treat anxiety and insomnia and alcohol withdrawal

oxbow.definition:
1) the land inside an oxbow bend in a river
2) a U-shaped curve in a stream
3) a wooden framework bent in the shape of a U; its upper ends are attached to the horizontal yoke and the loop goes around the neck of an ox

oxbridge.definition: general term for an ancient and prestigious and privileged university (especially Oxford University or Cambridge University)

oxcart.definition: a cart that is drawn by an ox

oxeye.definition:
2) Eurasian perennial herbs having daisylike flowers with yellow rays and dark centers
3) an oval or round dormer window

ox-eyed.definition: having large round eyes like those of an ox

oxford.definition:
1) a city in southern England to the northwest of London; site of Oxford University
2) a university town in northern Mississippi; home of William Faulkner
4) a low shoe laced over the instep

oxyacetylene.definition: a mixture of oxygen and acetylene; used to create high temperatures for cutting or welding metals

oxycephaly.definition: a congenital abnormality of the skull; the top of the skull assumes a cone shape

oxidant.definition: a substance that oxidizes another substance

oxidase.definition: any of the enzymes that catalyze biological oxidation

oxidation.definition: the process of oxidizing; the addition of oxygen to a compound with a loss of electrons; always occurs accompanied by reduction

oxidation-reduction.definition: a reversible chemical reaction in which one reaction is an oxidation and the reverse is a reduction

oxidative.definition: taking place in the presence of oxygen

oxide.definition: any compound of oxygen with another element or a radical

oxidise.definition: enter into a combination with oxygen or become converted into an oxide

oxidizable.definition: capable of undergoing a chemical reaction with oxygen

oxidize.definition: add oxygen to or combine with oxygen

oxidized.definition: combined with or having undergone a chemical reaction with oxygen

oxygen.definition: a nonmetallic bivalent element that is normally a colorless odorless tasteless nonflammable diatomic gas; constitutes 21 percent of the atmosphere by volume; the most abundant element in the earth's crust

oxygenase.definition: an oxidoreductase that catalyzes the incorporation of molecular oxygen

oxygenate.definition: impregnate, combine, or supply with oxygen

oxygenation.definition: the process of providing or combining or treating with oxygen

oxygenize.definition:
1) change (a compound) by increasing the proportion of the electronegative part; or change (an element or ion) from a lower to a higher positive valence: remove one or more electrons from (an atom, ion, or molecule)
2) dehydrogenate with oxygen

oxyhemoglobin.definition: the bright red hemoglobin that is a combination of hemoglobin and oxygen from the lungs

examples.en: oxyhemoglobin transports oxygen to the cells of the body

oximeter.definition: a measuring instrument that measures the oxygen in arterial blood

oxytetracycline.definition: a yellow crystalline antibiotic (trademark Terramycin) obtained from a soil actinomycete; used to treat various bacterial and rickettsial infections

oxytocic.definition: a drug that induces labor by stimulating contractions of the muscles of the uterus

oxytocin.definition: hormone secreted by the posterior pituitary gland (trade name Pitocin); stimulates contractions of the uterus and ejection of milk

oxytone.definition: word having stress or an acute accent on the last syllable

oxytropis.definition: large widely-distributed genus of evergreen shrubs or subshrubs having odd-pinnate leaves and racemose or spicate flowers each having a pea-like corolla with a clawed petal

oxlip.definition: Eurasian primrose with yellow flowers clustered in a one-sided umbel

oxonian.definition:
1) of or pertaining to or characteristic of Oxford University
2) of or pertaining to or characteristic of the city of Oxford, England, or its inhabitants

oxtail.definition: the skinned tail of cattle; used especially for soups

oxtongue.definition: widespread European weed with spiny tongue-shaped leaves and yellow flowers; naturalized in United States

ozarks.definition: an area of low mountains in northwestern Arkansas and southeastern Missouri and northeastern Oklahoma

ozena.definition: a chronic disease of the nose characterized by a foul-smelling nasal discharge and atrophy of nasal structures

ozone.definition: a colorless gas (O3) soluble in alkalis and cold water; a strong oxidizing agent; can be produced by electric discharge in oxygen or by the action of ultraviolet radiation on oxygen in the stratosphere (where it acts as a screen for ultraviolet radiation)

ozonide.definition: any of a class of unstable chemical compounds resulting from the addition of ozone to a double bond in an unsaturated compound
